intro: Leptomischus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered leptomischus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats.
